definition: to reveal one's talent (idiom)/to rise above others/to distinguish oneself
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
Wayne Wang (1949-), Chinese US film director
Michelle Kwan (1980-), former American figure skater, Olympic medalist
Deng Yingchao (1904-1992), Chinese communist leader, wife of Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来

sentences.english: The two traits of the male sterility and brown paddy hull are inherited independently.
sentences.chinese: 雄性不育性與褐色穎殼兩個性狀屬獨立遺傳。

sentences.chinese: 穎賢是一個有幹勁和外向的學生。

sentences.english: He found a word, ying, which means the bud of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 他發現了“穎”這個字，意思是樹的萌芽。

definition: surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
